message.content:
cs.LO, cs.FL, cs.PL, cs.DS, cs.LG 

The paper deals with automata and games for the $\mu$-calculus, which are topics typically studied in the areas of logic (cs.LO) and formal languages (cs.FL). The use of limit-deterministic parity automata suggests a connection to the theory of automata on infinite words, which is a subfield of both logic and formal languages. The construction of satisfiability games involves techniques from automata theory and graph theory, which are also relevant to the areas of programming languages (cs.PL), data structures (cs.DS), and theoretical computer science (cs.LG).
